conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C and needs to be predicted which container (D, E, or F) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
Liquid A (orange) begins at the top left.
Liquid A flows down and encounters the black baffle.
Liquid A diverts to the right and flows under the yellow baffle.
Liquid A continues downward and eventually enters container D.
Liquid B (light blue) begins at the top center.
Liquid B flows down and encounters the purple baffle.
Liquid B diverts to the right and flows under the light blue baffle.
Liquid B continues downward and enters container E.
Liquid C (pink) begins at the top right.
Liquid C flows straight down and enters container F without encountering any baffles.
Liquid A flows into container D.
Liquid B flows into container E.
Liquid C flows into container F.
Final answer: A to D, B to E, C to F.
